com.softwareag.wx.is.config.security

Class EncryptedValue

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.softwareag.wx.is.config.security.EncryptedValue

  • public class EncryptedValue
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents an encrypted value that is stored in Passman.
    There are multiple views on an encrypted value and they are listed below
    • Value: Assigned to key in config file.
      Example: For a line value = [[encrypted:handle]] the value is [[encrypted:handle]]
    • Handle: What is inside the encrypted "tag".
      Example: For [[encrypted:secretValue]] the handle is secretValue
    • Internal key: The key used inside Passman, the format is WxConfig:<PACKAGE_NAME>:<HANDLE> .
      Example: If [[encrypted:myPasswd]] is placed in IS package A, the internal key will be WxConfig:A:myPasswd

      • SEPARATOR_CFG_ID_IN_HANDLE

        public static final java.lang.String SEPARATOR_CFG_ID_IN_HANDLE
        Encrypted values are supported by CrossPackageInterpolation. In such a scenario, the cfgId (i.e. the name of the IS package) from where the value shall be taken will be prepended before the actual handle followed by this separator.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        public java.lang.String getValue()
        Get handler value as found in file (starts with "[[encrypted:"). Does not return the actual secret value (this is done by passmanGetValue()
        Returns:

      • setValue

        public void setValue(java.lang.String value)
        Set handler with value from config file. Format must match "\\[\\[encrypted:(.+)\\]\\]"
        Parameters:
        value - Hanlder value from config file

      • getDescription

        public java.lang.String getDescription()
        Get description, if it is defined. The required format is that a key exists with the value "encrypted.value.desc." + handle. Example: If the encrypted value is defined as "[[encrypted:dbPassword]]", the description must have a key ""encrypted.value.desc." dbPassword"
        Returns:
        description, if it is defined; null otherwise

      • getHoldingFileCanonicalPath

        public java.lang.String getHoldingFileCanonicalPath()

      • setHoldingFileCanonicalPath

        public void setHoldingFileCanonicalPath(java.lang.String holdingFileCanonicalPath)

      • addCfgIdToHandle

        public void addCfgIdToHandle()
        For CrossPackageInterpolation scenarios the handle is extended with the cfgId (i.e. the name of the IS package for which the value shall ultimately by retrieved). The change can be reversed via removeCfgIdFromHandle().

      • removeCfgIdFromHandle

        public void removeCfgIdFromHandle()
        Removes the link to another package (usually added by CrossPackageInterpolation by calling addCfgIdToHandle()) from the handle.

      • getInternalKey

        public java.lang.String getInternalKey()
        Get internal key, which is the technical key used to store data in passman
        Returns:
        internal key for use by passman

      • setInternalKey

        public void setInternalKey(java.lang.String internalKey)
        Set internal key, which will actually set the #cfgId and #handle
        Parameters:
        internalKey - Internal key as used to interact with passman

      • passmanExists

        public boolean passmanExists()
        Check if actual value is stored in passmann. An error will be logged if the value is not found there.
        Returns:
        true if value is found in passman, false otherwise

      • passmanGetValue

        public java.lang.String passmanGetValue()
        Retrieve actual (secret) value from passman
        Returns:
        value from passman, null if nothing is stored there

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        If compared object is also of type EncryptedValue the cfgId and value are compared. Otherwise the superclass is used, which effectively means the result will be false.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        true if cfgId and value match, false otherwise

        public static boolean isPassmanKey(java.lang.String value)
        Check whether a value from a configuration is actually a pointer to an encrypted value (without referring to another package)
        Parameters:
        value - Plain value as from configuration
        Returns:
        true if value is encrypted and not pointing to another package
